title: What are the effects of technology with the use of science to our society in this generation today? - Quora

response.answer_text: Technology continues to explode, and it changes everything. The technology is based upon the foundation of science. We could once keep pace with the change in info, traditions etc.. No more it seems, we need the kids, indeed the grand kids to help us with technology today. Its kind of amazing that humans who once grew old to become respected elders, are now irrelevant or worse, dependents. Yet, it does seem to be working, we are adaptable, even in our old age, although though I still have trouble distinguishing between tapping, swiping, pressing, and holding.

Except for a segment of conservative society in the US today, most people are more than willing to accept anything that science tells them. The success of technology seems to underwrite the validity of scientific knowledge. Younger generations have a frightening belief in the efficacy of technology to solve our problems. My fear is that (as MIT science observer Sherry Turkle points out)-we are not in danger of being taken over by machines but we ARE in danger of accommodating so thoroughly to machine technology that we will have lost a valuable connection to reality and the society of humans
